name: Fiesta 2013 Dog Medal
description:
Bruno P-Dawg came to San Antonio a short two months after Hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans. He is a rescue dog from the Crescent City and is a Rhodesian Ridgeback mix. Beyond that, Bruno's origins are shrouded in mystery.

Bruno's humans were not looking for a dog, but Bruno was looking for a home. At first, Bruno was a nervous and skittish addition to the family, not sure of his place, but eventually with TLC and time he came to love and be loved as he found his calling as an animal rights spokesdog.  

Bruno's passions are car rides, walks on the San Antonio River, and dark cool spaces under big old houses. His turn offs are domestic cheeses, water, and skunks.  

He is proud to be this year's co-medalist and looks forward to representing the honor that has been graciously bestowed upon him.

name: Fiesta 2012 Dog Medal
description:
The Cannoli Fund's 2012 dog medal features Cannoli’s neighbor, Samson, a purebred English springer spaniel. Samson, a stray, was scheduled to be euthanized at the city shelter because of a broken rear leg and other health problems. Thanks to a generous benefactor, he had surgery to repair his leg and was treated for heartworms. A kind and loving dog, Samson was first fostered and then adopted by his current owner. He gets along with everyone and maintains an extensive clientele of dogs and cats that appreciate his grooming skills. Samson is the perfect poster dog for animal rescue.

Medals are silver metal and enamel and hang from a grosgrain ribbon. They measure approximately 1-1/2" across by 3-1/2" tall including the ribbon and have a metal pin back.

name: Fiesta 2012 Cat Medal
description:
The Cannoli Fund's 2012 cat medal features Cannoli himself and one of the pupils that have successfully completed the curriculum at The Cannoli School for Social Engagement, or CSSE. The many kittens that have been schooled by Cannoli have gone on to lead productive lives, providing affection, amusement, and occasional mayhem to their lucky new owners. It seemed only fitting that this aspect of the Big C’s mission should be commemorated.

Medals are silver metal and enamel and hang from a grosgrain ribbon. They measure approximately 1-1/2" across by 3-1/2" tall including the ribbon and have a metal pin back.
